p: GC-MS analysis of the EOs demonstrated that C. cassia oil was composed of 91.22% trans-cinnamaldehyde, and M. spicata was mainly composed of carvone (57.78%) and limonene (25.28%). A detailed composition can be found in the Supplementary Tables 1, 2. The EO compositions are similar to those reported before ( Snoussi et al., 2015; Zhang et al., 2019). A stable nanoemulsion had a mean particle size diameter below 200 nm and a polydispersion index < 0.2.
